article.headline: Loyola Marymount 84, Boise State 82 (2 OT)
article.story: LOS ANGELES (AP) -- John Montgomery banked in a running, one-handed 10-foot shot with 2.6 seconds remaining in the second overtime Tuesday to give Loyola Marymount an 84-82 victory over Boise State. Following a Broncos' turnover with 10.3 seconds remaining, Montgomery drove down the right lane and fired up the game winner over a Boise State defender. It was his only field goal of the game. Matthew Knight went 13-for-20 from the field and scored a career-high 32 points for Loyola Marymount (8-5). Adoyah Miller had a career-high 23 points for the Lions and made a 3-pointer at the end of regulation to send the game into overtime. Miller made six of nine 3-pointers and had eight assists. Loyola Marymount's Damian Martin had a school-record nine steals to go with his 10 rebounds and six assists. Matt Nelson had 22 points and 13 rebounds for Boise State (5-5), and Larry Reggie had 19 points and 13 rebounds.
